definition: barbarian/slave servant/(old) contemptuous term for people from southern China (used by northern Chinese people)
barbarian/bullying/very/quite/rough/reckless
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: You must be raging and have at least one unused barbarian rage power.
sentences.chinese: 你必需處於狂暴並有最少一項未用的蠻子狂暴威能。

sentences.english: And she thinks Southerners are wild barbarians.
sentences.chinese: 她還把南方人當做蠻子。

sentences.english: Ancient Chinese call their neighboring people as "bugs" or"barbarians".
sentences.chinese: 古代漢族人把他們的鄰居稱作“蟲豸”或“蠻子”。

sentences.english: Barbarian's jumping attack covers quite a distance. Goes flying up staincase.
sentences.chinese: 蠻子的跳斬距離相當的遠，落地時仍有震波攻擊。

sentences.english: The barbarians defiled the church by using it as a stable.
sentences.chinese: 蠻子通過使用它排成了縱列前進教會作爲槽櫪。
